entries.title: More rail disruption as 9,000 train drivers strike
entries.description: Aslef union members at 13 rail companies walk out on Wednesday in a row over pay and conditions.

entries.title: Dussehra 2022: Celebrations take over India's streets
entries.description: Celebrations are being held on a massive scale for the first time since the Covid-19 pandemic.

entries.title: CEO Secrets: What's a modern boss to wear?
entries.description: Business leaders consider how the move towards more informal clothing attire at work affects them.

entries.title: US midterms: 'America's elections could turn really nasty'
entries.description: Amid warnings of violence, the first vote since the Capitol riot will be a huge test of US democracy.

entries.title: Take a ride around San Francisco in a driverless taxi
entries.description: Driverless robo-taxis are being allowed on the city's streets at night for paying members of the public.

entries.title: Mahsa Amini: How one woman's death sparked a movement
entries.description: The BBC has analysed over 1,000 videos of unprecedented protests following Mahsa Amini's death in custody.

entries.title: Inter Milan 1-0 Barcelona: Xavi furious at 'injustice' in Champions League defeat
entries.description: Inter Milan edge out Barcelona to leave the Spanish club at risk of a second successive group-stage elimination in the Champions League.

entries.title: Research call over MND risk to elite rugby players
entries.description: An expert calls for "immediate research" after a study suggests players could be at increased risk.

entries.title: Manchester City v Copenhagen: Pep Guardiola hails 'things not in stats' for Erling Haaland
entries.description: Erling Haaland is even better than his record-breaking statistics indicate, according to his Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola.

entries.title: King Charles should attend climate summit, COP26 president says
entries.description: Alok Sharma says the King has been a champion of the environment and other countries want him to attend COP27.

entries.title: Ukraine war: The families who made it through the new Iron Curtain
entries.description: The families fleeing Russian-occupied areas speak of their hopes and fears as the border hardens.

entries.title: Liz Truss's speech: PM to say disruption will be worth it for growth
entries.description: Liz Truss will use her first conference speech as prime minister to explain her economic policies.

entries.title: Eintracht Frankfurt 0-0 Tottenham Hotspur: Spurs unable to take their chances in goalless draw
entries.description: Tottenham are left to rue a number of missed chances as they are held to a goalless draw in Germany by Eintracht Frankfurt in the Champions League.

entries.title: Covid inquiry: Mark Drakeford accused of 'shameful' remarks
entries.description: Mark Drakeford criticised for saying "the world has moved on" after questions on Wales-only inquiry.

entries.title: Woman handcuffed in police car hit by train... and survives
entries.description: This is the moment a train collided with a police car in Colorado - with a woman in the back seat.

entries.title: Somalia drought: The fight for survival as famine looms
entries.description: Children are dying in growing numbers amid the worst drought to hit Somalia in 40 years.

entries.title: Just Fine gives King Charles III first winner at Leicester
entries.description: Just Fine makes history at Leicester as the first winner for King Charles III after he inherited the late Queen's horses.

entries.title: Mermaids trustee quits over paedophile-group links
entries.description: Dr Jacob Breslow resigns from the transgender charity after attending a paedophile-support conference.

entries.title: Men's Shed group unite to rebuild after arson attack
entries.description: A men's community group are rebuilding their shed, after it was destroyed by arson.

entries.title: Ukraine regains Kherson villages from Russians
entries.description: Russia's latest setbacks came as President Putin was due to sign into force annexation decrees.

entries.title: Ione Wells goes behind the scenes at the Tory conference ahead of Liz Truss's speech
entries.description: BBC political correspondent Ione Wells speaks to members behind the scenes at the Conservative party conference.

entries.title: Moors Murders: No bones found in search for Keith Bennett
entries.description: A new search for Keith Bennett has found "no evidence to suggest the presence of remains", police say.

entries.title: Woman admits defacing Captain Sir Tom Moore memorial
entries.description: Madeleine Budd admits criminal damage to the memorial in Derbyshire on Friday.

entries.title: BBC names inaugural Green Sport Award winners
entries.description: BBC Sport names its inaugural Green Sport Award winners - including former racing driver Leilani Münter and ex-rugby player David Pocock.

entries.title: Kwasi Kwarteng's fiscal plan really will be published early
entries.description: Despite confusion, the Treasury is going to release a long-awaited financial plan this month.

entries.title: Emma Raducanu: British number one knocked out of Ostrava Open by Daria Kasatkina
entries.description: Emma Raducanu is out of the Ostrava Open after losing to fifth seed Daria Kasatkina in the first round.

entries.title: Ukraine war: Crimea beauty queen fined over song
entries.description: Olga Valeyeva is fined nearly $700 by the Russian authorities and another woman is jailed for 10 days.

entries.title: Twitter shares halted after report Elon Musk deal to go ahead
entries.description: Trading in Twitter shares are suspended after a report stated the billionaire will now buy the business.

entries.title: Tory conference: Rebellion in the air over possible benefit squeeze
entries.description: Some Tory MPs are clear they will not back a move to end the link between benefits and inflation.

entries.title: Ryder Cup: Europe captain Luke Donald says next year's tournament can 'unify' golf
entries.description: Europe captain Luke Donald says the Ryder Cup is "bigger than any individual player" amid the crisis surrounding the breakaway LIV tour.

entries.title: Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang: Graham Potter praises 'perfect' Chelsea striker after burglary
entries.description: Chelsea boss Graham Potter praises the way forward Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang dealt with a violent robbery in his home in the summer.

entries.title: Leah Williamson: England captain to miss upcoming friendlies against USA and Czech Republic with injury
entries.description: England captain Leah Williamson is ruled out of the upcoming friendlies against the United States and the Czech Republic after sustaining an injury during training.

entries.title: Coldplay postpone Brazil shows over Chris Martin illness
entries.description: Chris Martin is under 'strict doctors orders' to rest after contracting a serious lung infection.

entries.title: Queen of Country music Loretta Lynn dies aged 90
entries.description: The singer's hits included Coal Miner's Daughter, Honky Tonk Girl and feminist anthem The Pill.

entries.title: Prince William warns of organised crime threat to wildlife
entries.description: The Prince of Wales says his campaigning to protect the environment is a way of honouring the Queen.

entries.title: Jonny Bairstow wins Cricket Writers' Club Bob Willis Trophy
entries.description: Jonny Bairstow wins the Bob Willis Trophy after being voted as England's player of the year by the Cricket Writers' Club.

entries.title: North Korea: What missiles does it have?
entries.description: North Korea has been conducting regular missile tests as part of its weapons development programme.

entries.title: Adam Walker: Former Hull KR and Scotland prop dies aged 31
entries.description: Former Hull KR and Scotland prop Adam Walker dies at the age of 31.

entries.title: Diana Panorama interview: BBC settles with Earl Spencer aide
entries.description: Alan Waller claimed false documents were used by Martin Bashir to win the late princess's trust.

entries.title: Wagatha Christie: Rebekah Vardy to pay Coleen Rooney £1.5m in legal costs
entries.description: Rebekah Vardy has been ordered to pay 90% of Coleen Rooney's legal costs following a defamation trial.

entries.title: Jamie George: Saracens and England hooker to miss autumn internationals
entries.description: Saracens and England hooker Jamie George is set to be out for 10 weeks with a foot injury.

entries.title: World's largest Pokémon collection could sell for £300k
entries.description: After 25 years of catching 'em all, the seller's haul of more than 20,000 items will now be sold.

entries.title: I won't let my abusive dad win any more - Alex Scott
entries.description: BBC broadcaster Alex Scott says the domestic abuse she experienced during her childhood is "still so raw".

entries.title: Bernie Ecclestone to face trial in October 2023 over alleged fraud
entries.description: Former Formula 1 boss Bernie Ecclestone will face trial next October following an investigation into an alleged failure to declare overseas assets.

entries.title: EU votes yes on common charging cable
entries.description: Euro-MPs vote to make all mobile devices use the same USB-C type charger from 2024.

entries.title: Iran schoolgirls remove hijabs in protests against government
entries.description: Dramatic scenes show teenagers waving headscarves and chanting against clerical authorities.

entries.title: Gateshead: Boy, 14, held in murder probe into teenager's death
entries.description: A 14-year-old boy is held on suspicion of the murder of another teenager in Gateshead.

entries.title: Asian Winter Games to be held in Trojena, Saudi Arabia in 2029
entries.description: Saudi Arabia will host the Asian Winter Games in 2029 at a mountain resort that is currently being constructed.

entries.title: I'm still in favour of lower tax for high earners, says Liz Truss
entries.description: But Liz Truss says she is not currently contemplating trying again to get rid of the 45p tax rate.

entries.title: Mortgage rates still rising as big lenders revise deals
entries.description: The average rate of a new two-year fixed rate mortgage is 6% as the UK's biggest lenders change prices.

entries.title: Ukraine war: Liberated town shows human cost of Russia's defeat
entries.description: The BBC's Orla Guerin finds desolate scenes in Lyman, a town Ukraine recaptured from Russia.

entries.title: Sajid Khan in Bigg Boss 16: Row over Bollywood director in Indian Big Brother
entries.description: Thousands have criticised the inclusion of filmmaker Sajid Khan, who was accused of sexual misconduct.

entries.title: WATCH: Coyote strays into California school toilets
entries.description: The coyote was given the nickname "Wile E." after the Warner Brothers character.

entries.title: Jim Redmond: Tributes paid after death of Derek Redmond's father
entries.description: Jim Redmond, who famously helped his injured son Derek cross the 400m finish line at the 1992 Barcelona Olympics, has died aged 81.

entries.title: Chris Kaba: Inquest opens into death of man shot by police
entries.description: A coroner offers his condolences to the family of Mr Kaba, who was due to become a father.

entries.title: Tory conference: Liz Truss declines to say she trusts Kwasi Kwarteng
entries.description: The prime minister was asked several times if she trusts Kwasi Kwarteng with future policy decisions.

entries.title: Physics Nobel rewards science at the smallest scales
entries.description: This year's prize recognises quantum mechanics - the science that describes nature at the scale of atoms and smaller.

entries.title: Rugby World Cup: England want to 'create a movement' like Lionesses
entries.description: England scrum-half Leanne Infante says they want to "create a movement" at the Rugby World Cup, emulating football's Lionesses as they seek victory to grow their sport.

entries.title: Pound hits two-week high after debt plan U-turn
entries.description: Kwasi Kwarteng will bring forward details of how he would cut debt to try to reassure investors.

entries.title: England in Pakistan: Moeen Ali rules out return for Test series
entries.description: All-rounder Moeen Ali rules out a Test comeback for England's tour of Pakistan in December, saying he is "done" with Test cricket.

entries.title: Tracey Neville to become assistant coach at Adelaide Thunderbirds
entries.description: Former England netball coach Tracey Neville is to join the Adelaide Thunderbirds as assistant coach.

entries.title: Liverpool dog attack: Man arrested after woman killed
entries.description: A 31-year-old man is held on suspicion of owning a dog dangerously out of control in Liverpool.

entries.title: Shimron Hetmyer: West Indies batter ruled out of Men's T20 World Cup after missing flight
entries.description: Shimron Hetmyer will not play in the Men's T20 World Cup for the West Indies after missing a rescheduled flight to the tournament.

entries.title: Education: New Wales GCSEs to put less emphasis on exams
entries.description: Plans are to change the names and teaching of some subjects, including science and Welsh language.

entries.title: Tenants' relief as rent freeze to be fast-tracked
entries.description: The emergency legislation at Holyrood also provides for a six-month moratorium on evictions.

entries.title: Tony Hickmott: Autistic man to be released after 21 years in hospital
entries.description: Mum of Tony Hickmott, who has been held in a secure hospital since 2001, says: "He's coming home."

entries.title: Newspaper headlines: Liz Truss 'faces new Tory rebellion' after tax cut U-turn
entries.description: Tuesday's papers are dominated by claims the PM faces a new revolt over public spending cuts.

entries.title: Green Sport Awards: Conserving all life is paramount - Leilani Münter
entries.description: Leilani Münter is the winner of the BBC's Evergreen Athlete Award, which is part of its inaugural Green Sport Awards.

entries.title: Helping others with one-handed life hacks
entries.description: Chiara Beer makes videos to help people who, like her, have to carry out tasks with one hand.

entries.title: Chris Eubank Jr v Conor Benn: Can duo emerge from their fathers' shadows?
entries.description: Chris Eubank Jr and Conor Benn prepare to face each other 30 years on from their fathers' iconic rivalry.

entries.title: Women's Footballer of the Year contender Alexia Putellas
entries.description: BBC Sport profiles Barcelona and Spain midfielder Alexia Putellas, one of five nominees for the BBC Women's Footballer of the Year 2022 award.

entries.title: Women's Footballer of the Year contender Beth Mead
entries.description: BBC Sport profiles Arsenal and England winger Beth Mead, one of five nominees for the BBC Women's Footballer of the Year 2022 award.

entries.title: TikTok designer creates jewellery from bacteria
entries.description: Scottish artist Chloe Fitzpatrick found fame on TikTok after sharing her unusual creative process.

entries.title: Women's Footballer of the Year contender Wendie Renard
entries.description: BBC Sport profiles Lyon and France defender Wendie Renard, one of five nominees for the BBC Women's Footballer of the Year 2022 award.

entries.title: Women's Footballer of the Year contender Alexandra Popp
entries.description: BBC Sport profiles Wolfsburg and Germany forward Alexandra Popp, one of five nominees for the BBC Women's Footballer of the Year 2022 award.

entries.title: Women's Footballer of the Year contender Sam Kerr
entries.description: BBC Sport profiles Chelsea and Australia forward Sam Kerr, one of five nominees for the BBC Women's Footballer of the Year 2022 award.

entries.title: Four women to run post office and count penguins in Antarctica
entries.description: The team will also monitor a colony of gentoo penguins on Goudier Island for five months.

entries.title: Liz Truss refuses to rule out real-terms benefit cuts
entries.description: The PM is facing opposition from some Tory MPs over how the government will pay for its growth plans.

entries.title: BBC Women's Footballer of the Year 2022: Winner announced on 9 November
entries.description: Vote now for the BBC Women's Footballer of the Year 2022, with the winner announced on 9 November.

entries.title: BBC Women's Footballer of the Year 2022: Sam Kerr profile
entries.description: BBC Sport profiles Chelsea forward Sam Kerr, one of five nominees for the BBC Women's Footballer of the Year 2022 award.

entries.title: BBC Women's Footballer of the Year 2022: Wendie Renard profile
entries.description: BBC Sport profiles France and Lyon defender Wendie Renard - one of five nominees for the BBC Women's Footballer of the Year 2022 award.

entries.title: Women's Footballer of the Year 2022: Alexia Putellas profile
entries.description: BBC Sport profiles Barcelona midfielder Alexia Putellas, one of five nominees for the BBC Women's Footballer of the Year 2022 award.

entries.title: Women's Footballer of the Year nominee Popp
entries.description: BBC Sport profiles VfL Wolfsburg's German forward Alexandra Popp, one of five nominees for the BBC Women's Footballer of the Year 2022 award.

entries.title: Women's Footballer of the Year nominee Beth Mead
entries.description: BBC Sport profiles Arsenal forward Beth Mead, one of five nominees for the BBC Women's Footballer of the Year 2022 award.

entries.title: Alys Thomas: Wrist injury forces Olympic swimmer's retirement
entries.description: Former Commonwealth champion Alys Thomas has been advised to end her career immediately to avoid potentially permanent damage to her wrist.

entries.title: Calais migrants: Smugglers cause fresh problems for police
entries.description: New Calais smuggling networks are making it even harder to stop rising numbers of Channel crossings.

entries.title: North Korea fires ballistic missile over Japan
entries.description: Some Japanese woke up to the sound of sirens and a warning to take cover as the missile flew overhead.

entries.title: Nick Kyrgios seeks dismissal of assault case on mental health grounds
entries.description: The tennis player - who is accused of assaulting an ex-partner - cites his struggles with mental health.

entries.title: Covid inquiry first preliminary hearing to begin
entries.description: The inquiry's first module looks at pandemic preparedness, as campaigners say lessons must be learned.

entries.title: Edenfield Centre: Care watchdog praised bosses at abuse hospital
entries.description: Inspectors also endorsed staff "values" at a time when the BBC was filming patients being mistreated.

entries.title: Confidence Man: Key revelations from new book on Donald Trump
entries.description: The former president weighed bombing Mexican drug labs and nearly fired his daughter, a new book claims.
